title: How to Unpin an App from Start in Windows 10

steps.headline: Open the Start menu.
steps.description:
Click the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} button in the lower-left corner of your screen. Alternatively, press the ⊞ Win key.

steps.headline: Locate the tile you wish to unpin.
steps.description: Once the menu is open you should see a series of live tiles on the right-hand side of your Start menu.

steps.headline: Right-click the tile.
steps.description: A black context menu should appear.

steps.headline: Unpin the tile.
steps.description: Select Unpin from Start from the top of the context menu. The tile should be removed from Start. It may take a few seconds. If it's taking longer, re-open Start or restart Windows Explorer.

text:
Open the Start menu. Click the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} button in the lower-left corner of your screen. Alternatively, press the ⊞ Win key. Locate the tile you wish to unpin. Once the menu is open you should see a series of live tiles on the right-hand side of your Start menu. Right-click the tile. A black context menu should appear. Unpin the tile. Select Unpin from Start from the top of the context menu. The tile should be removed from Start. It may take a few seconds. If it's taking longer, re-open Start or restart Windows Explorer.
sentences:
Click the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of a Windows icon.\n<\/p>

License: Public Domain<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} button in the lower-left corner of your screen.
Locate the tile you wish to unpin.
Once the menu is open you should see a series of live tiles on the right-hand side of your Start menu.
A black context menu should appear.
Select Unpin from Start from the top of the context menu.
The tile should be removed from Start.
It may take a few seconds.
If it's taking longer, re-open Start or restart Windows Explorer.
